sen.j: 井戸 良弘（いど よしひろ、天文 (元号)元年（1532年） - 慶長17年（1612年））は戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Yoshihiro IDO (1532 - 1612) was Busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (Japan).
Yoshihiro IDO (1532 - 1612) was Busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (Japan).
Yoshihiro IDO (1532 - 1612) was Busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (Japan).
He was the son of Satohiro IDO
He was the son of Satohiro IDO
He was the son of Satohiro IDO
His wife was the daughter of Junkei TSUTSUI.
His wife was the daughter of Junkei TSUTSUI.
His wife was the daughter of Junkei TSUTSUI.
Saisuke
sen.cmt: ・訳抜本文の「才助。」について、意味するところがわかりませんでした。「才女」に対する才助なのか、あるいは役職名なのか、幼少時の名前とも思われますが、定訳不明です。調査すると、Saisuke の読みが最も多かったため、そのようにしました。
sen.e: Saisuke
He served as Wakasa no kami (Military governor of Wakasa Province).
He served as Wakasa no kami (Military governor of Wakasa Province).
He served as Wakasa no kami (Military governor of Wakasa Province).
He was the lord of Ido-jo castle.
He was the lord of Ido-jo castle.
He was the lord of Ido-jo castle.

sen.j: 大和国の国人領主の一人として筒井氏に仕えていたが、永禄年間には松永久秀のため居城井戸城を攻め落とされるなど苦戦した。
sen.e: Yoshihiro served TSUTUI clan as one of the Kokujin ryoshu (local samurai lord) in Yamato Province, but he had a hard time during Eiroku era (1558 - 1570) when Ido-jo Castle in which he had lived was captured by Hisahide MATSUNAGA.

Yoshihiro served TSUTSUI clan as one of the Kokujin ryoshu (local samurai lord) in Yamato Province, but he had a hard time during Eiroku era (1558 - 1570) when Ido-jo Castle in which he had lived was captured by Hisahide MATSUNAGA.

Yoshihiro served TSUTSUI clan as one of the Kokujin ryoshu (local samurai lord) in Yamato Province, but he had a hard time during Eiroku era (1558 - 1570) when Ido-jo Castle in which he had lived was captured by Hisahide MATSUNAGA.

sen.j: のちに井戸城を息子の井戸覚弘に譲って、自らは織田信長に仕える。
sen.e: Later he ceded Ido-jo Castle to his son Satohiro IDO, then he served Nobunaga ODA.
Later he ceded Ido-jo Castle to his son Satohiro IDO, then he served Nobunaga ODA.
Later he ceded Ido-jo Castle to his son Satohiro IDO, then he served Nobunaga ODA.

sen.j: 数々の戦功により山城国填島二万石を任された。
sen.e: As a reward for his distinguished war service, he was put in charge of Makishima 20,000 Koku (approximately 3.6 million liters of crop yield).
As a reward for his distinguished war service, he was put in charge of Makishima 20,000 Koku (approximately 3.6 million liters of crop yield) in Yamashiro Province.
As a reward for his distinguished war service, he was put in charge of Makishima 20,000 Koku (approximately 3.6 million liters of crop yield) in Yamashiro Province.

sen.j: しかし1582年、本能寺の変の後に起こった山崎の戦いで羽柴軍に与さなかった為に改易されてしまう。
sen.e: However, in 1582, his rank and properties were forfeited because he didn't join HASHIBA army at the Battle of Yamazaki, which broke out after Honnoji Incident.
However, in 1582, his rank and properties were forfeited because he didn't join HASHIBA army at the Battle of Yamazaki, which broke out after Honnoji Incident.
However, in 1582, his rank and properties were forfeited because he didn't join HASHIBA army at the Battle of Yamazaki, which broke out after Honnoji Incident.

sen.j: 関ヶ原の戦いでは、東軍の細川幽斎の元につき、丹波国田辺城で西軍の小野木重勝軍を相手に篭城。
sen.e: In the Battle of Sekigahara, Yoshihiro followed Yusai HOSOKAWA, who ruled the Eastern camp, and held Tanabe-jo Castle in Tanba Province to fight against the Western Camp ruled by Shigekatsu ONOGI.
In the Battle of Sekigahara, Yoshihiro followed Yusai HOSOKAWA, who ruled the Eastern camp, and held Tanabe-jo Castle in Tanba Province to fight against the Western Camp ruled by Shigekatsu ONOGI.
In the Battle of Sekigahara, Yoshihiro followed Yusai HOSOKAWA, who ruled the Eastern camp, and held Tanabe-jo Castle in Tanba Province to fight against the Western Camp ruled by Shigekatsu ONOGI.

sen.j: 戦後は大和国に戻り、余生を過ごした。
sen.e: After the war, he returned to Yamato Province and spent the rest of his life there.
After the war, he returned to Yamato Province and spent the rest of his life there.
After the war, he returned to Yamato Province and spent the rest of his life there.

sen.j: なお、井戸氏にはこの良弘の子孫で同じく良弘と名乗った人物が数名存在する。
sen.e: As an aside, Yoshihiro had several descendants who were also named Yoshihiro in the IDO clan.
As an aside, Yoshihiro had several descendants who were also named Yoshihiro in the IDO clan.
